structMember.name: meanPathDelay
structMember.description: The current value of the mean propagation time between a master and slave clock as computed by the slave.

structMember.name: offsetFromMaster
structMember.description: The current value of the time difference between a master and a slave as computed by the slave.

structMember.name: stepsRemoved
structMember.description: The number of communication paths traversed between the local clock and the grandmaster clock.

struct.name: DefaultDS
struct.description: Attributes related with default dataset to describe local clock.

structMember.name: clockAccuracy
structMember.description: Accuracy of a clock.

structMember.name: clockClass
structMember.description: Clock class.

structMember.name: clockIdentity
structMember.description: String with hexadecimal words representing identity of PTP device.

structMember.name: domainNumber
structMember.description: Domain number of clock.

structMember.name: numberPorts
structMember.description: Number of PTP ports on clock. For an ordinary clock, value is 1.

structMember.name: offsetScaledLogVariance
structMember.description: Stability of a clock.

structMember.name: priority1
structMember.description: priority1 attribte value that is used in execution of BMC algorithm.

structMember.name: priority2
structMember.description: priority2 attribute value that is used in execution of BMC algorithm.

structMember.name: slaveOnly
structMember.description: Whether clock is slave-only.

structMember.name: twoStepFlag
structMember.description: Whether clock is one-step clock or two-step clock.

struct.name: ParentDS
struct.description:
Structure describing parent clock.
Parent clock to which ordinary clock synchronizes and it can also be grandmaster (clock at root of master-slave hierarchy).

structMember.name: grandmasterClockAccuracy
structMember.description: Accuracy of grandmaster clock.

structMember.name: grandmasterClockClass
structMember.description: Clock class of grandmaster clock.

structMember.name: grandmasterIdentity
structMember.description: String with a hexadecimal word representing identity of grandmaster clock.

structMember.name: grandmasterOffsetScaledLogVariance
structMember.description: Stability of grandmaster clock.

structMember.name: grandmasterPriority1
structMember.description: priority1 attribute value of grandmaster clock that is used in execution of BMC algorithm.

structMember.name: grandmasterPriority2
structMember.description: priority2 attribute value of grandmaster clock that is used in execution of BMC algorithm.

structMember.name: observedParentClkPhaseChgRate
structMember.description:
Estimate for phase change rate of parent clock, as measured by slave clock.
Value is represented as hexadecimal word.

structMember.name: observedParentOffsetScalLogVar
structMember.description:
Stability of parent clock.
Value is represented as hexadecimal word.

structMember.name: parentClockIdentity
structMember.description: Identity of parent port.

structMember.name: parentPortNumber
structMember.description:
Value of port number on PTP node with a single PTP port is 1.
Values of port numbers for N ports on PTP node supporting N PTP ports are 1, 2, â€¦N. All zeros and ones values for port number are reserved.

structMember.name: parentStats
structMember.description:
Whether values of observedParentOffsetScaledLogVariance and observedParentClockPhaseChangeRate are measured and valid.
Value true indicates valid data.

struct.name: TimePropertiesDS
struct.description: Attributes related with time properties dataset to describe local clock.

structMember.name: currentUtcOffset
structMember.description:
UTC offset.
When epoch is PTP, it is possible to calculate UTC time using value of currentUtcOffset.
Value of currentUtcOffset is as follows: currentUtcOffset = TAI - UTC.

structMember.name: currentUtcOffsetValid
structMember.description: Whether timePropertiesDS.currentUtcOffset is known to be correct.

structMember.name: frequencyTraceable
structMember.description: Whether frequency determining timescale is traceable to primary reference.

structMember.name: leap59
structMember.description: Last minute of current UTC day contains 59 seconds in case PTP time epoch is used.

structMember.name: leap61
structMember.description: Last minute of current UTC day contains 61 seconds in case PTP time epoch is used.

structMember.name: ptpTimescale
structMember.description: Whether clock timescale of grandmaster clock is PTP.

structMember.name: timeSource
structMember.description: Source of time used by grandmaster clock.

structMember.name: timeTraceable
structMember.description: Whether time and timescale are traceable to primary reference clock.

enumMember.name: GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK
enumMember.description: PTP clock that only operates as Grand Master.

enumMember.name: BOUNDARY_CLOCK
enumMember.description: PTP clock that operates as Boundary Clock.

enumMember.name: SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK
enumMember.description: PTP clock that only operates as slave only ordinary clock.

enum.name: ClockAccuracy
enum.description:
Available clock accuracy types.
The clock accuracy characterizes a clock for the purpose of the Best Master Clock (BMC) algorithm.

enumMember.name: NO_FAULT
enumMember.description: No fault detected.

enumMember.name: PDV_PROBLEM
enumMember.description: Too many Packet Delay Variation in network.

enumMember.name: CLOCK_CLASS
enumMember.description: Received clock class is not good enough for synchronization.

enumMember.name: CLOCK_ACCURACY
enumMember.description: Received clock accuracy is not good enough for synchronization.

enumMember.name: TIME_NOT_TRACEABLE
enumMember.description: Time is not traceable to primary time reference clock.

enumMember.name: TIME_SCALE_NOT_PTP
enumMember.description: Time scale is not PTP from primary time reference clock.

enumMember.name: ERRATIC_SYNC
enumMember.description: Synchronization messages are arriving irregularly, but are not totally missing. Could indicate packet loss in network.

enumMember.name: LOW_ANNOUNCE_RATE
enumMember.description: Too few announce messages received per second.

enumMember.name: LOW_SYNC_RATE
enumMember.description: Too few sync messages received per time interval.

enumMember.name: LOW_DELAY_REQ_RATE
enumMember.description: Allowed delay request rate indicated from master is too low.

enumMember.name: LOW_DELAY_RSP_RATE
enumMember.description: Too few delay response messages received per second.

enumMember.name: NO_ANNOUNCE
enumMember.description: No announce messages are detected.

enumMember.name: NO_SYNC
enumMember.description: No synchronization messages are detected.

enumMember.name: NO_DELAY_RSP
enumMember.description: No delay response messages are detected.

enumMember.name: NO_MESSAGES
enumMember.description: No messages are detected. Check ptpPortStatus attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO for PTP port information.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: Status information not available.

enumMember.name: IEEE_1588_J3
enumMember.description:
Since 17.Q4. Planned to be removed.
Default profile based on IEEE1588-2008 appendix J3.
Selecting this profile requires that ptpMulticastAddress attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO must be set according to network planning.

enumMember.name: G_8275_1
enumMember.description:
Telecom profile for time synchronization according to G.8275.1.
Selecting this profile requires that ptpMulticastAddress attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO must be set according to network planning.

enumMember.name: G_8265_1
enumMember.description:
Telecom profile for frequency synchronization according to G.8265.1.
Selecting this profile requires that associated grandmaster attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO must be set.

enumMember.name: G_8275_2
enumMember.description:
Telecom profile for (assisted) partial time support according to G.8275.2.
Selecting this profile requires that associated grandmaster attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO must be set.

enumMember.name: IEEE_1588_TIME_DEFAULT
enumMember.description:
Default profile based on IEEE1588-2008 appendix J3 but with packet rate of 8 event packets per seconds.
Selecting this profile requires that ptpMulticastAddress attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO must be set according to network planning.

enumMember.name: IEEE_1588_TIME_SLOW
enumMember.description:
Default profile based on IEEE1588-2008 appendix J3 but with packet rate of 64 event packets per second and long locking time.
Selecting this profile requires that ptpMulticastAddress attribute in PtpBcOcPort MO must be set according to network planning.

enum.name: TimeSource
enum.description: Indicates the source of time used by the grandmaster clock.

derivedDataType.name: ClockDomain
derivedDataType.description:
The type of clock domain number.
A domain consists of one or more PTP devices communicating with each other as defined by the protocol. A domain defines the scope of PTP message communication, state, operations, data sets, and time scale.

derivedDataType.name: ClockPriority
derivedDataType.description: The type of the clock priority.

class.name: BoundaryOrdinaryClock
class.description: Represents boundary clock, grandmaster ordinary clock, or slave-only ordinary clock. Type of PTP clock is specified by clockType.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='not(@clockType eq 2 and count(PtpBcOcPort) gt 1)'> <value-of select="."/> SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK can only have one PtpBcOcPort MO </assert> <assert test='every $dn in @domainNumber satisfies not(count(../BoundaryOrdinaryClock[($dn eq @domainNumber) and ((@ptpProfile eq 1) or (@ptpProfile eq 2) or (@ptpProfile eq 5) or (@ptpProfile eq 6))]) gt 1)'> <value-of select="."/> If ptpProfile is IEEE_1588_J3, or G_8275_1, or IEEE_1588_TIME_DEFAULT, or IEEE_1588_TIME_SLOW, only one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO can exist in same ptp domain. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='not(@clockType eq 2 and count(PtpBcOcPort) gt 1)'> <value-of select="."/> SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK can only have one PtpBcOcPort MO </assert> <assert test='every $dn in @domainNumber satisfies not(count(../BoundaryOrdinaryClock[($dn eq @domainNumber) and ((@ptpProfile eq 1) or (@ptpProfile eq 2) or (@ptpProfile eq 5) or (@ptpProfile eq 6))]) gt 1)'> <value-of select="."/> If ptpProfile is IEEE_1588_J3, or G_8275_1, or IEEE_1588_TIME_DEFAULT, or IEEE_1588_TIME_SLOW, only one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO can exist in same ptp domain. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: boundaryOrdinaryClockId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: clockType
attribute.dependencies: If SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK, BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO can only have one PtpBcOcPort MO. If GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK, BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO cannot have ptpProfile G_8265_1 or G_8275_2. If BOUNDARY_CLOCK, BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO cannot have ptpProfile G_8265_1 or G_8275_2.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: domainNumber
attribute.description:
PTP domain.
Number must be unique for each clock domain of the network.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: priority1
attribute.description:
Priority one used in Best Master Clock (BMC) Algorithm.
Lower values take precedence. Attribute value is subject to PTP network planning. Attribute not used in frequency profile.
If clockType is SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK, only valid value is 255.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: priority2
attribute.description:
Priority two used in Best Master Clock (BMC) Algorithm.
Lower values take precedence. Attribute value is subject to PTP network planning. Attribute not used in frequency profile.
If clockType is SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK, only valid value is 255.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: ptpProfile
attribute.description:
PTP profile in used.
Note that selected profile has dependencies to other attributes.
attribute.dependencies: If IEEE_1588_J3 or G_8275_1, or IEEE_1588_TIME_DEFAULT, or IEEE_1588_TIME_SLOW, all ordinary clocks must have unique PTP domain number. If IEEE_1588_J3, or G_8275_1, or IEEE_1588_TIME_DEFAULT, or IEEE_1588_TIME_SLOW, only one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO can exist in same ptp domain.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: Ptp
class.description:
This MO class is the top class for Precision Time Protocol management.
Dependencies: Maximum one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK can be created. Maximum one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType BOUNDARY_CLOCK can be created. Cannot co-exist with other types of BoundaryOrdinaryClock MOs. Maximum 8 BoundaryOrdinaryClock with clocktype SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK can co-exist.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 0]) le 1'> <value-of select="."/> Maximum one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK can be created.</assert> <assert test='count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 1]) le 1'> <value-of select="."/> Maximum one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType BOUNDARY_CLOCK can be created.</assert> <assert test='count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 2]) le 8'> <value-of select="."/> Maximum 8 BoundaryOrdinaryClock MOs with clockType SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK can co-exist.</assert> <assert test='not(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[(@clockType eq 0) and ((@ptpProfile eq 3) or (@ptpProfile eq 4))])'> <value-of select="."/> GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK cannot have ptpProfile G_8265_1 or G_8275_2.</assert> <assert test='not(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[(@clockType eq 1) and ((@ptpProfile eq 3) or (@ptpProfile eq 4))])'> <value-of select="."/> BOUNDARY_CLOCK cannot have ptpProfile G_8265_1 or G_8275_2.</assert> <assert test='not(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 1] and count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock) gt 1)'> <value-of select="."/> BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType BOUNDARY_CLOCK cannot co-exist with other BoundaryOrdinaryClock MOs.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 0]) le 1'> <value-of select="."/> Maximum one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK can be created.</assert> <assert test='count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 1]) le 1'> <value-of select="."/> Maximum one BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType BOUNDARY_CLOCK can be created.</assert> <assert test='count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 2]) le 8'> <value-of select="."/> Maximum 8 BoundaryOrdinaryClock MOs with clockType SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK can co-exist.</assert> <assert test='not(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[(@clockType eq 0) and ((@ptpProfile eq 3) or (@ptpProfile eq 4))])'> <value-of select="."/> GRAND_MASTER_ORDINARY_CLOCK cannot have ptpProfile G_8265_1 or G_8275_2.</assert> <assert test='not(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[(@clockType eq 1) and ((@ptpProfile eq 3) or (@ptpProfile eq 4))])'> <value-of select="."/> BOUNDARY_CLOCK cannot have ptpProfile G_8265_1 or G_8275_2.</assert> <assert test='not(BoundaryOrdinaryClock[@clockType eq 1] and count(BoundaryOrdinaryClock) gt 1)'> <value-of select="."/> BoundaryOrdinaryClock MO with clockType BOUNDARY_CLOCK cannot co-exist with other BoundaryOrdinaryClock MOs.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: ptpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.
